I tried to search the japanese renpy-doc in "http://ja.renpy.org/doc/html/" for a keyword with the search box.
But this searches english renpy-doc even if in japanese doc.

data.title: A thumb of a vscrollbar doesn't be resized correctly.
data.body:
In many case, a thumb of a vscrollbar doesn't be resized correctly.

options

```
    style.vscrollbar.xmaximum = 24
    style.vscrollbar.thumb_offset = 0
    style.vscrollbar.top_gutter = 5
    style.vscrollbar.bottom_gutter = 5
    style.vscrollbar.top_bar    = Frame("image/system/vscrollbar.png", 5,5)
    style.vscrollbar.bottom_bar = Frame("image/system/vscrollbar.png", 5,5)
    style.vscrollbar.thumb      = Frame("image/system/vscrollbar_thumb.png", 5, 5)

    style.vscrollbar.hover_top_bar    = Frame("image/system/vscrollbar_hover.png", 5,5)
    style.vscrollbar.hover_bottom_bar = Frame("image/system/vscrollbar_hover.png", 5,5)
    style.vscrollbar.hover_thumb      = Frame("image/system/vscrollbar_thumb_hover.png", 5, 5)
```

screen 

```
        has vbox
        $ adj0 = ui.adjustment(value=0, range=0)
        $ adj1 = ui.adjustment(value=1, range=1)
        $ adj2 = ui.adjustment(value=1, range=2)
        $ adj3 = ui.adjustment(value=1, range=3)
        $ adj4 = ui.adjustment(value=1, range=4)
        $ adj5 = ui.adjustment(value=1, range=5)
        $ adj6 = ui.adjustment(value=1, range=6)
        $ adj7 = ui.adjustment(value=1, range=7)
        $ adj8 = ui.adjustment(value=1, range=8)
        $ adj9 = ui.adjustment(value=1, range=9)
        $ adj10 = ui.adjustment(value=1, range=10)
        hbox:
            bar adjustment adj0 style 'vscrollbar'
            bar adjustment adj1 style 'vscrollbar'
            bar adjustment adj2 style 'vscrollbar'
            bar adjustment adj3 style 'vscrollbar'
            bar adjustment adj4 style 'vscrollbar'
            bar adjustment adj5 style 'vscrollbar'
            bar adjustment adj6 style 'vscrollbar'
            bar adjustment adj7 style 'vscrollbar'
            bar adjustment adj8 style 'vscrollbar'
            bar adjustment adj9 style 'vscrollbar'
            bar adjustment adj10 style 'vscrollbar'
```

data.title: Missing play licensing library.
data.body:
C:\todo\renpy\renpy\rapt\android-sdk\tools\ant\build.xml:471: Invalid file: C:\todo\renpy\renpy\rapt\android-sdk\extras\google\play_licensing\library\build.xml

This seems to be showing up for a lot of people. Why?

data.title: If narrator is assined nvl to, _default_empty_window doesn't work.
data.body:
_default_empty_window assumes narrator is adv character.
If narrator is assigned nvl to, this doesn't work.

I have two ideas.
1: Use Character(None, kind=adv, what_style='say_thought')("", interact=False) in place of narrator.
2: Create the new character _narrator which is same as narrator.

What do you think?

data.title: consistent crash [pythonw.exe stopped responding] no traceback
data.body:
using verison 6.17.3.327 on windows 7 x64

 A standalone game that quickly demonstrates the problem: http://www.mediafire.com/download/946vmkyw8708ltj/game_crash_test.rar

run the game, when text appears right click to open the save screen. on this screen click the top right tab that should take you to the main menu. instead, it crashes.

seems related to me messing with the standard keybindings for rightclick.

data.title: RenPy does not support HDPI (retina) displays
data.body:
Observed on a 15" Retina display MacBook Pro running OSX 10.9.2

Seems like a typical "resolution is a lie" bug where the OS claims the size is in points whereas OpenGL and other low-lever graphics libraries claim the resolution is in pixels.  This results in sizes being incorrect.  Screenshot and log file from Loren the Amazon Princess (1.3) attached:
![screen shot 2014-04-02 at 2 10 36 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5036529/2618604/a69aa680-bc23-11e3-9634-8f86ac3e0ab6.png)
![screen shot 2014-04-02 at 2 10 43 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5036529/2618605/a69b5648-bc23-11e3-96fe-4e2827a59d4b.png)

Logfile reads:

data.title: Updater needs _bar style.
data.body: The default updater needs a _bar style we don't define.

data.title: List of action
data.body:
I allowed sensitive and selected statuses of a list of Actions to be controlled by SelectedIf and SensitiveIf.
If these are in list, these are used to check status as priority.

When use a list of many Actions, These are useful.

data.title: Add application category for OS X
data.body:
The Applications folder in OS X is large and installers tend to expect apps to stay where they were placed (i.e. the root of /Applications). Since Lion, there's been application category metadata for View --> Arrange by Application Category but if the metadata's not in info.plist, the app gets sorted into "Other" at the bottom. 

https://developer.apple.com/library/Mac/releasenotes/General/SubmittingToMacAppStore/#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40010572-CH16-SW8 (this applies to all Mac apps, not just those installed through App Store).

data.title: 6.17.3 Launcher fails to work with already built games
data.body: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=32&t=25911

data.title: Cursor issue in Linux version of Planet Stronghold
data.body:
In Planet Stronghold the cursor resets to the center of the screen on pause (and sometimes while moving the cursor) in full screen. The cursor works normally in windowed mode. The game developer asked me to file a bug report here as a library issue.

System Specs
Kubuntu 13.10 64-bit
8 GB ram
2 GB OC Nvidia 760 GT
AMD 8320 OC to 3.76 Ghz
3 TB HD

data.title: Update Spanish translation of the Template and the Launcher
loading save in developer mode while in release crashes game
data.body:
Again see here for the traceback:
http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=25801

this is rather easy to reproduce: just save a game with developer = True, exit it, set developer = False and try to reload the same save!

data.title: weird dictionary behavior (var not reset when reloading previous save)
data.body:
See the demo I've posted in lemmasoft:
http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=25800

data.title: Crash on CMD-Q on Mac
data.body: http://txt.shiz.me/MzMyNWM2.txt

data.title: Problems with show layer <name> at pos
data.body: It looks like there may be a problem updating the layer after this occurs.

data.title: Holding down SHIFT doesn't bring up renderer selection
data.body:
The "Dealing With Display Problems" section of the current documentation says "If upgrading your video drivers does not fix the problem, [...] Hold down shift while starting Ren'Py [...]".  This doesn't appear to work; holding down shift doesn't do anything useful.

Reproduced using Ren'Py 6.17.3 on Windows 8.1.

data.title: Microsoft Visual C++ Runtime Library runtime error caused by repeatedly accessing the pause menu
data.body:
The following error is displayed:

```
Microsoft Visual C++ Runtime Library
---------------------------
Runtime Error!
Program: C:\Documents\...
This application has requested the Runtime to terminate it in an unusual way.
Please contact the application's support team for more information.
```

the console reads

```
Fatal Python error: (pygame parachute) Segmentation Fault
```

It can be triggered by quickly mashing the escape key 3 times while in game. Then navigating to a save menu inside the pause menu which uses FileCurrentScreenshot(). In my case the pause menu. In my case the transitions to and from the pause menu are set to a 0.5 sec Dissolve. Triggering the bug seems to rely on the speed at which the escape key is pressed, and even with the right speed it only appears only about 20% of the time.

Further information:
Windows 7, 32 bits

data.title: FileCurrentScreenshot R and B channels are swapped
data.body:
When using FileCurrentScreenshot(), the R and B channels of the image appear swapped.
If a save is made using the screenshot the colors on the FileScreenshot() appear correct though.

data.title: Stricter image attribute checking.
data.body: <TheSHAD0W> Hi.  Working to debug a project, and I'm having problems with characters where attributes aren't available, and it's failing silently...  Is there a way to set it more strict, so it'll throw an error if image attributes aren't present

data.title: "selected_hover_background" is not a keyword argument
data.body:
When I put the selected_hover_background under a button, this error pops up

```
File "game/screens.rpy", line 272: u'selected_hover_background' is not a keyword argument or valid child for the button statement.
    selected_hover_background "GUI/Save-Load/bxs.full-hover.png"
```

But if I put the selected_hover property in the style statement like this style.large_button.selected_hover_background, it works.

Also http://www.renpy.org/doc/html/keym.html seems to be an older version of /keymap.html

data.title: dereferencing type-punned pointer will break strict-aliasing rules
data.body:
Pretty low priority since I cannot reproduce any bugs that might be related to these warnings. Still, it would be good to take care of them (on Gentoo these are considered general QA issues which indicate that the package may exhibit random runtime failures).

Sure, you can compile with "-fno-strict-aliasing", but that is a _huge_ penalty and generally not advised even if we have compiler warnings.

Here are some references and possible solutions to this problem:
http://mail-index.netbsd.org/tech-kern/2003/08/11/0001.html
http://thread.gmane.org/gmane.linux.gentoo.devel/39495
http://gcc.gnu.org/bugs/#nonbugs_c


data.title: *.* problem
data.body: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&p=312525

data.title: i18n fixes and translatable console
data.body:
This branch uses __() instead of _() in the position picker to show translated strings.
Additionaly, it uses __() in the console to make it translatable.

data.title: use double colons to show codes correctly
data.body: Please use double colons (::) instead of single colons to show codes correctly.
